text:
I am trying to use a custom formatter for tests that are run by the batchtest

        <junit fork="yes" errorProperty="test.failed" 
failureProperty="test.failed" forkmode="once">
            <classpath refid="test.classpath"/>
            <jvmarg value="-Djava.awt.headless=true"/>
            <formatter classname="my.Formatter" extension=".xml"/>
            <batchtest todir="${test.data.dir}" unless="testcase">
                <fileset dir="${test.class.dir}">
                    <include name="**/*Test.class"/>
                </fileset>
            </batchtest>
        </junit>

For some misterious reason, the extension specified in the formatter does not 
get used. All generated test files end with "null" instead of ".xml"

If i replace the batchtest tag with a single test tag, the correct extension is 
used :

            <test name="my.Test" todir="${test.data.dir}"/>
creator: janssk1@hotmail.com

text:
Seems to work for me.

Can you give us the result of running Ant with the -verbose command line switch,
please?
creator: bodewig@apache.org
janssk1@hotmail.com

creator: bodewig@apache.org
text:
Hmm, you said it wouldn't use the extension, but the debug log would suggest
you basename wouldn't work, while the extension did:

> formatter=com.alcatel.util.ant.StrippedDownXmlJunitFormatter,C:\NetworkIn
spector\build\testdata\null.xml

Has anything changed or do you still see the extension as null in your tests?

Still null extension. 
Do you have an idea why the basename is null ?
creator: janssk1@hotmail.com

text: Should be fixed with nightly build 2005-03-25.
creator: bodewig@apache.org

text: *** Bug 36461 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
creator: bodewig@apache.org
